Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jo J
Reviews.Content: myself and my family were due to stay at the hotel Saturday night. When we arrived, we couldn't believe our eyes, there is a skip outsiade and workmen everywhere, the windows on the first floor were being replaced, and all the glass was outside on the drive. The parking was a good mile away. When we went inside, no one was at the reception desk (if you could call it that) then a lady arrived and when we asked if it was a hotel she just looked at us and shouted up the stairs. The owner then came down, I really wasn't convinced it was a hotel, only until he confirmed my reservation. We looked at the room and decided to cancel our stay. The owner just said what do you expect with a discounted price!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best budget hotels in Shepherds Bush.”
Reviews.Author: tony h
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in quite a few budget hotels in the Shepherds Bush and this one is probably the best. In general the place does feel a bit DIY but the rooms are always clean and the ensuite facilities decent. Rooms at the front of the hotel are a little noisy as Wood Lane is a busy road.

Reviews.Title: “Abbey 'Shabby' hotel London”
Reviews.Author: Dave A
Reviews.Content: This place should be shut down. Stayed at the Abbey Hotel Sept 2011. The only hotel I have ever stayed at that did not have tea and coffee facilities (manager used current renovations as excuse - go figure). TV did not work, pillows were more like sacks, and the bathroom was closet like although new, and the phone could not be used to access outside lines (despite this listed as a feature along with tea/coffee facilities). Staff were friendly although more out of apology than anything. Hotel should be renamed "Shabby Hotel". Definitely not of three star standard as reputed. At 76 pounds per night it was a rip off. Disapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Vile”
Reviews.Author: Wani1
Reviews.Content: Iv never done this before but this place is something else. I appreciate that it's a budget hotel but it really was bad! To start with the parking is a good 35 minute walk away(not mentioned on the website.) The women who works there was really rude and unhelpful. The whole place is filthy, I had to sleep fully dressed from fear of getting bitten, not sure if the bathroom had ever been cleaned. The breakfast was really bad... There was some cold toast which i think had been toasted several days before using a cigarette lighter, there was a very small glass of juice and a croissant. The table cloth looked like it was about to walk off! It was quite comical really. Definitely wouldn't stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous - dont go there!”
Reviews.Author: jen_reg
Reviews.Content: The situation of the B & B (that's being generous!) was handy being opposite The Westfield Shpping Centre and BBC studios. The sheets were clean, but the rest felt filthy. The walls were grotty and chipped as was the furniture. No toiletries and towels like sandpaper. Breakfast consisted of 3 cold croissants and cold toast. The coffee was disgusting despite putting milk in which was begrudgingly given. We were spoken to rudely and asked if we had finished as other people were waiting. People next to us were given mouldy toast which they refused. Luckily we were only booked for 1 night and had we not had an engagement I would have found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Bed and Horrible Lady”
Reviews.Author: travelgweilo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Had to pay in full on checking. Wished I had not! Car park a joke as literally miles away. Given bad direction from lady at receptionâ€¦second mistakeâ€¦ Reception lady/owner has a real bad attitude - not very nice person at all and argues with other guests! Other people there were nice enough. Could not sleep muchâ€¦bed springs were about to poke out of the mattress and very noisy from reception lady/owner on phone constantly at night. Would not stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: WendyWooEssex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 11th August. Location very good for the BBC studios and excellent shopping centre opposite. However, when we got up in the morning there was no water. Was told there was a little but there wasnt. Then was told it would be an hour until water came back (which meant 8am) and then was told 12 midday. So because we had to be out of room by 11 we asked could we wait till water came on, NO!!! So i then asked for a refund, NO!!! Although there was no water, we were given 2 glasses of water to clean our teeth with!!!!!! How did that happen then cos she told us she didnt have any bottled water when we asked. Ok, these things happen, but you would at least expect an apology!!!!!!!! The room was very basic, dirty, scruffy and lumpy pillows. For anyone reading this, seriously think twice about coming here, its worth paying the extra money and go somewhere where you come out feeling relaxed and refreshed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hattie66
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrid, very dirty, room falling apart. When woke in the morning was faced with no runing water so couldnt have a shower or go to the toilet, as would not flush, manager/owner unhelpful in this matter no part refund offered and no sorryness given at all. Would not recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Girl1986
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. I stayed there with a friend, and we both agree - the room was small, and the interior wasn't very modern, but everything was clean, the beds were great, no problem getting hot water even though we stayed on the top floor, the breakfast was nice, and the people working at the hotel are very service minded and polite! The hotel is close to (at least) three underground stations, so there's never a problem getting around. Sure, there's a little noise from the traffic, but hey - you're in London, what do you expect? We were in London to go shopping, sightseeing and clubbing, and we thought the hotel was great. We just needed a nice, clean room to sleep in, and that's exactly what we got. This is an excellent hotel if you want a cheap, but clean room close to central London.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joe_santoro
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights. The bathroom in the first room was the size of a wardrobe. The shower was so small I could not get into it. The bathroom and bed room was very dirty and horrible. The road noise was very loud I could not sleep. They move me to another room - the shower door fell apart when trying to use it. The bathroom was very dirty I had to leave.

Reviews.Title: “delivers what a cheap london hotel should”
Reviews.Author: hastingsranger
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small and basic, there is also road noise from the front, but this is the sort of hotel you go to for specfic purpose not a weeks holiday. I went for the football(5mins, just walk round the corner) and a meeting in the city( 20mins on central line). I found it clean, well placed ,warm and welcoming, the en suite is tight but usable and breakfast adequate. Not a Ramada or Jarvis but not 90 quid either. If you want the facilities of the hotel chains stay away, you will disappointed , if you want a nights sleep near central London, you could do worse.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Across the Street to Westfield Shopping Centre”
Reviews.Author: Franklyn25
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at Abbey hotel for 2 Nights, our main purpose was shoppig and this hotel has exactly met our purpose. The Lady at the reception (Katia) was very helpful and friendly from the very begining she answered all our questions and gave us direction to where we should go. The Breakfast was basic but not bad, considering the price it was more than what we were expecting. The Location of the Hotel is simply perfect, exactly across the street to westfield, and 10 min by tube to oxford street (Marble Arch). The Hotel area is very safe at night with many restaurants and pubs which cater for all budgets. Nearby the hotel there is also a market, sheperd's bush market where you can find good deals. The rooms are basic and not very big but good enough once again considering the price. Finally I would like to encourage all maltese travellers to try out this hotel as the hotel staff are very welcoming towards maltese. The Abbey hotel proved out to be a gr8 deal!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: IsabelleJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: The manager and his assistant were absolutely charming! They were kind and helpful and made us feel very welcome. The bedroom and bathroom, though small, were clean and totally adequate for our needs. We were served a lovely breakfast each morning â€“ cereal, toast, croissants â€“ by a very sweet lady. Good rate and close to underground station and bus stop. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone who is travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, smelly, rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: Petra95
Reviews.Content: The hotel was smelly, the toilet wouldn't flush properly, hot water was a rarity, the toilet paper was damp, towels were not clean, and the staff were incredibly rude when any complaints were made. The floor of the room was filthy, it looked like no one had ever bothered to clean. The worst hotel I have ever stayed at , it completely ruined my holiday in London.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Atravellerfrombrazil
Reviews.Content: I'm from Brazil. I was traveling with my wife by car and find this hotel passing in front of it. It was a good experience. The subway was near. The room was very clean. I had a place to park my car. But what think it was the best was the kindness of the manager. He even helped me to carry my heavy luggage upstairs. It's very rare in Europe...

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Book”
Reviews.Author: cez
Reviews.Content: In Sep I booked to stay at this hotel as i was going to the INXS gig nearby. 24 hours before i was due to stay here (OCT 12) I received an email saying that my booking was cancelled. I rang the hotel & spoke to a very rude man who told me that i had cancelled the room, I assured him that was not the case & that i still required the room. He then rang me back & agreed that it was their error but they still couldnt accomodate me or offer to help me find another hotel at such short notice. Obviously i cant comment on the hotel but if their customer service is anything like their hotel then i would advise you to find another hotel. I also contacted hotel/com whom i had booked the hotel through. They apologised & explained that there was nothing they could do as they only advertise the hotel on their site.

HotelInfo.Name: Abbey Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 23 Wood Lane | Shepherds Bush, London W12 7DP, England
